content.title: Radiofrequency Ablation of Saphenous Veins
content.description: Minimally invasive endovenous thermal ablation using radiofrequency energy to heat and occlude incompetent superficial veins.
content.mechanism: Radiofrequency catheter heats vein wall to 120°C, causing collagen contraction, endothelial damage, and fibrotic occlusion

procedure.positioning: Catheter tip 2cm from SFJ (or SSV junction)
procedure.tumescent: Perivenous saline/lidocaine for compression and heat sink

absolute: Acute superficial thrombophlebitis extending to junction
